intro: Doliocarpus oaxacanus, commonly known as the Oaxacan sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive sand-like leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
